requirement_designation: First Year Seminar with Race & Ethnicity(*)
class_notes: This course is designed to prepare you to think critically about the importance of ethical practices in biomedical research and medicine. The goal is also to inform students of how major lapses in ethical judgment have had detrimental long-lasting effects on our society. Students who take this course will learn how to analyze incidents of poor bio-ethical practice in research and medicine throughout our history. This course will connect these incidents with long term impacts on racial and ethnic minorities, those of differing sexual/gender identities, and other vulnerable populations. Students will use scholarly resources to independently study individual historical cases and analyze contemporary effects of health disparities and societal racial dynamics.
